gemBase.unit: useums museums museums museums museums museums museums museums museums museums muse
Sederholm House, Aleksanterinkatu 16-18, tel. (09) 169 3625.
The oldest stone building in downtown Helsinki.
The museum reflects the life of the merchant Johan Sederholm in 18th century Helsinki, the building and its restoration.
Disabled persons: access for wheelchairs, lift, Inva-WC.
Tuomarinkylä Museum, Tuomarinkylä Manor, tel. 728 7428.
The main building and the outhouses date from 1790.
Large manor park.
Exhibition devoted to life at the manor.
Ticket also valid for the Children's Museum.
Disabled persons, difficult for wheelchairs, assistant needed.
Other services: Cafe Tuomarinkylän Kartano in the yard, tel. (09) 728 5700.
Open Mon-Sat 11-22, Sun 11-20, 80 seats (terrace in the summer for 40), lunch from 40 FIM, coffee and pastry c. 15 FIM.
Children's Museum, in one of the outhouses at Tuomarinkylä Manor, tel. (09) 752 1694.
Exhibitions showing the life of children and young people, seen through their eyes.
Ticket also valid for the Tuomarinkylä Museum.
Disabled persons: difficult for wheelchairs, assistant needed.
Worker's Home Museum, Kirstinkuja 4, tel. (09) 146 1039.
A museum showing how workers lived in Helsinki 1909-1980.
The building was one of the first homes to be built for workers by the City of Helsinki.
Open May-September.
Disabled persons: no access for wheelchairs.
The City Museums are open Wed-Sun 11-17.
Note!
The Helsinki City Museum branch on Sofiankatu is open all year round Mon-Fri 9-17, Sat-Sun 11-17.
The Sederholm House is also open June-August Mon-Sun 11-17.
Admission: adults 20 FIM, children (under 18) free, OAPs 10 FIM, OAP groups 10 FIM/person, other groups 10 FIM/person.
Free admission on Thursdays.
Guides during opening hours 200 FIM, Burgher's House 100 FIM, bookings tel. (09) 169 3949 and 169 3443.
Helsinki Car Museum, Munkkisaarenkatu 12, tel. (09) 667 123.
Open Mon-Fri 12-15, Sat-Sun 11-16.
Some 30 roadworthy cars used e.g. by statesmen.
Waxworks of famous Finns, over 4,000 models of Mercedes-Benz cars.
Cars hired out for special occasions.
www.hel.fi
Admission: adults 30 FIM, children (7-15 years) 10 FIM, OAPs 15 FIM, groups (10 or more) 15 FIM/person.
Disabled persons: access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
Other services: Merilinja cafeteria, tel. (09) 654 101, same entrance as for Car Museum.
Open Mon-Thu 9-19.30, Fri 9-14, Sat-Sun closed.
Seating for c. 55, lunch 28-40 FIM.
Groups should book in advance.
Cable Factory, Tallberginkatu 1
Hotel and Restaurant Museum, at the Cable Factory, tel. (09) 693 1774.
Open Tue-Fri 12-18, Wed 12-20, Sat-Sun 12-17.
Photographic Museum of Finland, at the Cable Factory, tel. (09) 686 6360.
Closed for repairs, reopening 29.1.1999.
Open Tue, Thu and Fri 12-18, Wed 12-20, Sat-Sun 12-17.
Admission: charge to be announced when the museum opens.
Guided tours (for a fee) to be booked in advance.
Disabled persons: access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, lift.
Other services: cafe and restaurant at the Cable Factory.
Theatre Museum, at the Cable Factory, tel. (09) 694 5088.
Closed for repairs until autumn 1999.
The museum has another branch at Aleksanterinkatu 12, tel (09) 649 5088.
Theatre Adventure exhibition.
Open by arrangement.
Admission: adults 20 FIM, children (over 7) 10 FIM, OAPs 10 FIM, OAP groups 10 FIM/person, other groups 10 FIM/person.
Guides 150 FIM/group.
Disabled persons: no access for wheelchairs at the Aleksanterinkatu museum.
Natural History Museum (Zoological Museum), Pohjoinen Rautatienkatu 13, tel. (09) 191 7400.
Mammals, birds, fish invertebrates, etc.
Groups of animals in natural settings.
Special exhibition, Aliens, in spring 1999.
Free advice on mushrooms in autumn.
Museum open all year round Mon-Fri 9-17, Sat-Sun 11-16.
Guides may be booked in advance.
Admission: (higher price for special exhibitions) adults 25 FIM, children (7-15 years) 10 FIM, OAP groups booking in advance 10 FIM/person, no other group reductions.
Guided theme tours by arrangement (mammals, birds, evolution).
www.hel.fi
